file_content.text: This seedy place. Now Big Boss and Blizz look for shiny Jedi man. He have fish head.
Oh! Blizz see Jedi man!
Hey! Jedi man! Blizz want you to meet Blizz friend!
Didn't I tell you I was busy! I haven't got any more work--hey, I don't have a price on my head, do I?
Maybe? Blizz not look. Big Boss searching for Forcey-people, so Blizz think Big Boss should meet important Jedi man.
Your boss is a Jedi--uh, fellow Jedi. Haven't seen you around the enclave. You, um, aren't from around here?
I am Master <FirstName>. I'm no stranger to Nar Shaddaa, but I don't call it home.
Well, I'd offer a fellow master a drink since you're here, but I was just leaving, so just put it on my tab--goodbye!
I am Master <FirstName>. Barsen'thor of the Jedi Order.
Right, the, uh, Barsen'thor... well, someone of your, ah, station, probably need to see the masters of the enclave. Just over that way!
Your boss is a soldier? You don't want me to lead some sort of daring attack, do you...? 'Cause I could--but I'm real busy with Jedi business right now.
Master Jedi. I didn't come to speak with you about any specific operation, but I am looking for help.
Ah, that's too bad. I, um, I'm over on my help quota right now--Jedi union rules. Maybe try the enclave, may the Force be with you and all that!
Captain! Is that really you captain--or am I having a vision? Either way, good news!
Why, Languss Tuno, as I live and breathe. How're the gills?
Okay, words I would not use to describe Guss: shining anything.
Remind me to buy Sana some Force-glasses before we leave.
Ooo! Can Blizz try?
Si-- Si-- Sith...? Yes! Of course they would, alien filth. The, ah, foolish creature can't tell a Sith from a Jedi. You address Lord Struction.
I am Darth <FirstName>. Formerly the Emperor's Wrath.
I am Darth Nox. Formerly of the Dark Council.
I am Darth Imperius. Formerly of the Dark Council.
I am Darth Occlus. Formerly of the Dark Council.
D--Darth--I mean, I'm honored great... murderous... one. Surely I'm beneath your notice, so I'll just....
The little Jawa works uh, for, you? If you're trying to squeeze me, he was all I could afford! Jedi aren't made of money, you know!
They tend to be worth more to the right buyer. Not why I'm here.
Maybe, er, keep that to yourself next time you see one. Little wisdom from your friendly, neighborhood Jedi Master. Well, nice meeting you!
Er.... The, um, alien filth I can understand not getting the message, but you should mind a, ah, Sith's wishes. Why do you bother Lord Struction?
Korriban must have been very unpleasant for a Mon Calamari. I'm sure it shaped you into a formidable Sith, Lord Struction.
Of course it did! You would be wise to grovel before me, but, uh, later. I'm busy right now, so....
This is the shining man from Sana's vision?
Blizz think fish-head man look kinda wet and shiny. Maybe he sweat lots?
Oh, Captain, I'd hug you, but after my experience with Akaavi my understanding of personal space has been forever altered.
If I'd known it was you the Jawa was insisting I talk to I would have been on the first shuttle off Nar Shaddaa!
Well, I'm flattered, but I can never keep too far from this scuzzy little rock for long.
About that, Captain.
The little guy is like a magnet for interesting characters. And garbage.
Blizz only wanted compactor parts!
If I'd known it was you, I would have conserved the fuel.
Aw, I know you don't mean that, Captain.
You've been gone a long time. Nobody'd seen or heard from you. Just poof, vanished out in Wild Space.
I thought maybe you pulled a Nok Drayen.
I kind of did. He still holds the record for most time as a metal popsicle and he can keep it.
Wait, really? What's it like? Were you tucked away--or, ah, maybe on display like a bronzed award for daring and, um, pulchritude?
I had you all on my mind, there just wasn't much I could do about it.
I know the feeling. I spent a lot of time thinking about what happened. It, uh, feels bad... being helpless when it really matters.
You really thought I'd just ditch my ship, my crew, and my legacy to hide someplace until all the trouble blew over?
Um, no, not... when you put it like that. I just, you know, liked it better than believing you died out there.
I've been kind of lost without you. I drifted... then I settled. Finally I thought maybe if I'd been a real Jedi, you know.
I found a new master here. Nothing like my old one. Kind of like me, but successful.
Huh, maybe there was something to all that mystic nonsense Sana was spouting after all.
See! Blizz good at this!
That's great! With a little training I'm sure you'll be the fastest Force-kick in the galaxy.
Or at least Force-pinch. I'm trying to keep my expectations reasonable.
Haven't given up on that pipe dream?
We both know I'm not cut out for being a proper Jedi, but with the right teacher I might shine!
Maybe fish head really is shiny-man! Boss old friend is Jedi, and stick in mud like colorful-lady say!
Stick in the mud? Have you even met another Jedi? Wait--I think that might be the only part I understood.
I have a mystic friend who had a vision about me finding a Jedi. Blizz thinks it's you.
I--I got my own prophecy? Even destiny picked me last! Captain, will you call me Chosen One?
How about you join back up with me? I've got this new thing going, kind of a big deal.
Well, Captain, I was really thinking about giving up the Jedi dream for good, but now that you're here... it's like a second chance!
Nevermind him, tell me about this master of yours.
Well, uh, master might be stretching it. I haven't exactly gotten him to teach me anything yet, but I'm wearing him down!
I think you should meet my master. If anyone can convince him to train me, it'd be you!
Do you take me for a fool?
What? No! I'd never think... that. You're important, I can tell! I shouldn't waste your time--I'll just be going....
I wasn't born yesterday.
Like that's any feat--I mean, wisdom comes with more than age. Look deeply... maybe over that way.
Hey! Blizz promise Big Boss that Blizz find shiny-man so Big Boss and shiny-man can talk. Fish head better listen!
I--uh, yes, sir. Don't let the lack of ears fool you, I'm hanging on every word.
Answer me one question: are you really Force-sensitive?
Yes, that much is true. I haven't really used it, per se--I mean, I want to! I've always wanted to, but Jedi life....
See, Big Boss! Just like colorful-lady say! Fish head mope here in dark all the time instead like he not know where to go!
We've gotten off on the wrong foot. Blizz spoke highly of you, so I wanted to meet. That's all.
Blizz think maybe fish head is shiny-man from colorful-lady's vision.
I've seen enough. This has been a complete waste of my time, Blizz.
But, Big Boss, what about colorful-lady's vision? Shiny-man supposed to be important!
Fish head man all sweaty and shiny in the light, have wide eyes that point two directions, and Jedi like Big Boss wanted!
Wait! Hold on! Let's rewind back before the Jawa's insensitivity toward the moisture-dependent--this shining man someone important? Respected?
I thought you didn't want to talk?
I don't--I mean, I didn't. But then you started talking about some lady's visions.
Possibly. All we really know is a Voss Mystic believes he can help us.
Oh, uh, when you put it like that, it sounds pretty important.
Of which you are neither.
Things you're not.
No need to be rude about it.
It's just--I'm thinking: what if destiny's finally knocking? Like it's been at the wrong doors for years and by the time it reaches yours nobody's really expecting an answer.
I was just about to give up on getting trained again, then you show up!
I didn't come here to train you in the Force.
Well, I'm glad I made you reconsider, but that's not why I'm here.
Again? How many times have you quit?
I lost track of the number of times I thought about it, but this time would have been my second... the last time stuck for a while.
I don't need a Jedi academy wash out.
I never even entertained the possibility, but, er, maybe you help me prove myself to my master? Like a spiritual tutor.
You ever consider maybe I'm supposed to show you who you're looking for? Like some mystic guide?
I should take you to my master!
I've come this far.
Maybe we really are on to something.
See! Blizz good at colorful-lady's games!
If you're any indication of his ability, I'll pass.
Master might be overstating it... more like advisor. Okay--guy I've been pestering to train me.
See, Blizz told Big Boss that Blizz find Jedi!
Big Boss should go! Blizz wait for Big Boss, smuggle-moon have lots for Blizz to do. Bye-bye fish head!
He's not far! You won't regret this--I swear on my Jedi honor.
